title: Study of young athletes suggests snoring and sleep apnea are linked to sudden cardiac death

title_detail.value: Study of young athletes suggests snoring and sleep apnea are linked to sudden cardiac death

summary: A study of university rugby players has shown that they are more likely to suffer sleep disordered breathing than an average middle-aged man. The study also showed that the athletes who experience this problem are also more likely to have low levels of oxygen in their blood and higher pulse rates during the night, suggesting that athletes with sleep disordered breathing may be at risk of heart abnormalities.
